workDone.label: what I did
workDone.value: Designed Clean Architecture, implemented resume gamification: bubble physics on D3, animations on GSAP, levels/lives/achievements/bonuses, chatbot, responsiveness, FPS optimization, and production build.

sections.text: Bubbleme is an interactive resume-game: skills and experience are represented as bubbles that can be 'popped', studied, and collected achievements. The project demonstrates my approach to architecture, UX, and animations through gameplay.
Everything is built on Clean Architecture principles: domain separation, use cases, repositories, and factories. This simplifies improvements and experiments with game design without code chaos.

I use classic gameplay practices: experience, levels, lives, achievements, bonuses, hidden elements. Strong focus on UX/UI — animations, color scheme, adaptive layers, and careful micro-effects for any device.

Chronology from memoirs: started in July 2025, idea of interactive resume-game after contract with Aeroflot, initially had backend (Node/Express/SQLite) — then removed for pure frontend; deep refactoring under Clean Architecture, DDD and use-case approach, then focus on interaction, modal queues, shake effects, and adaptive FPS.

Much work went into experiments with LLM and code autogeneration: lots of reworks and refactorings, moments of deadlock, but the result — architecture and integration with neural networks, where any changes are made quickly and without errors.

blocks.text: Classic resume poorly conveys engagement and real depth of skills. Wanted a format that immediately shows architectural approach, advanced animations, and attention to UX, not just a list of items.

Create a gamified resume where user interacts with skills as game elements: physics, progress, achievements, bonuses, questions. At the same time, code should remain clean, extensible, and ready for experiments.

Final timeline took about two months: several waves of refactoring under Clean Architecture and DDD, complete abandonment of initial backend (Node/Express/SQLite) in favor of frontend-only, restructuring domains and use-case layer, adapting physics and animations for mobile devices, FPS optimization, and repackaging UI/UX with cinematic animations and modal queue.

blocks.subtitle: Architecture and stack
blocks.text: Applied Clean Architecture: domains (levels, bonuses, chat, modals, filter), use cases, repositories, and factories. Vue 3 + TypeScript + Vite, global state on Pinia, UI on Tailwind. Started with Node/Express/SQLite, then consciously removed backend and moved everything to frontend for simplicity and speed.

blocks.subtitle: Gameplay systems
blocks.text: Made level system (1–5) and lives, achievements for actions, bonuses with unique effects, philosophical questions. There are hidden and 'tough' bubbles, secrets in each year.

blocks.subtitle: Bubble types and experience
blocks.text: Bubbles reflect technologies and skills: color, size, and XP depend on proficiency level. Philosophical bubbles require choosing an answer: correct gives experience, wrong takes a life. There are 'tough' bubbles (need several clicks) and hidden ones — they can be found with cursor.

blocks.subtitle: Interaction and effects
blocks.text: Modal queue with priorities, shake effects for UI, micro text movements, particles and fragments. Animations are synchronized with business logic: we wait for effects to complete before next events, so UX feels cinematic.

blocks.subtitle: Physics and animations
blocks.text: Bubble physics on D3.js: collisions, reaction to cursor. Animations and micro-effects on GSAP: particles, shakes, smooth modals. Visual style — dark neon theme with frosted glass.

blocks.subtitle: Performance
blocks.text: Monitor FPS and automatically reduce number of stars/nodes to maintain stable framerate. When FPS drops, reduce background stars and number of bubbles on screen. Optimized animations, added debounces and lazy initialization.

blocks.subtitle: Chatbot and communications
blocks.text: Added chatbot and contact widget, there's a separate demo in Telegram. Easily expandable for FAQ or leads.

blocks.subtitle: Filters and categories
blocks.text: Filtering bubbles by categories/years and quick onboarding. Can quickly find needed skill or experience block.

blocks.subtitle: Content and localization
blocks.text: Content is in JSON, can be edited without code changes. There's language switching and saving choice in localStorage.

blocks.subtitle: Onboarding and achievements
blocks.text: Welcome scenario, hints, achievement system and rewards for exploring resume. Micro-animations support sense of progress.

blocks.subtitle: Memoirs by levels
blocks.text: For completing levels, 'memoirs' open — mini-stories about development, architectural decisions, backend abandonment, and project evolution. This enhances narrative and motivation to go further.

Result — a resume that immediately shows technical depth and attention to UX. Smooth animations, stable FPS, clean architecture, and readiness for new modes/mini-games. Memoirs by levels reveal development path. Demo available at bubbleme.space.
